perturbation.original_text:
4.   PUBLICITY AND ADVERTISING

Subject to Section 7, Reseller and MediaNet Group Technologies agree that broad publicity with respect to the relationship developed by this Agreement, and the advantages of such relationship, will be permitted and actively encouraged and supported by both parties. This publicity initiative will include, but is not limited to, a press releases issued by Reseller and MediaNet Group Technologies, publicizing the strategic alliance between the parties, on site promotion and email campaigns. In this regard, Reseller and MediaNet Group Technologies shall agree on the form, content of the press release prior to its release. MediaNet Group Technologies must approve any advertising prior to issuance and placement.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.   PUBLICITY AND ADVERTISING

Subject to Section 7, Reseller and MediaNet Group Technologies agree that broad publicity with respect to the relationship developed by this Agreement, and the advantages of such relationship, will be permitted and actively encouraged and supported by both parties. This publicity initiative will include, but is not limited to, press releases issued by Reseller only, publicizing the strategic alliance between the parties, on site promotion and email campaigns. In this regard, only Reseller shall determine the form and content of the press release prior to its release. Reseller may issue advertising at its sole discretion and MediaNet Group Technologies approval is not needed.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces ambiguity regarding who controls publicity. Originally, both parties agreed on press releases and MediaNet had approval over advertising. Now, the Reseller has sole discretion over press releases and advertising, contradicting the initial agreement and creating uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text:
9.1 TERM. The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date
and continue for a period of 1 year after the Effective Date, unless
earlier terminated as set forth herein (the "TERM"). This Agreement shall
renew for successive 1-year periods, after the initial 1 Year Term, if
agreed by both parties in writing within 30 days of license expiration.
Either party may terminate the Agreement on 60-days written notice during a
renewed term. However, in no event shall termination of this Agreement by
MediaNet Group Technologies relieve it of the obligation to remit payment
to Reseller for sales or Portals, Hosting Services or other products and
services to or through Buyers contracted by Reseller prior to such
termination. The obligation to remit payment cease 30 days after
termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.1 TERM. The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date
and continue for a period of 1 year after the Effective Date, unless
earlier terminated as set forth herein (the "TERM"). This Agreement shall
renew for successive 1-year periods, after the initial 1 Year Term, if
agreed by either party in writing within 30 days of license expiration.
Either party may terminate the Agreement on 60-days written notice during a
renewed term. However, in no event shall termination of this Agreement by
MediaNet Group Technologies relieve it of the obligation to remit payment
to Reseller for sales or Portals, Hosting Services or other products and
services to or through Buyers contracted by Reseller prior to such
termination. The obligation to remit payment continue until all buyers who purchase portals or host websites with MediaNet as a direct result of the activities of Reseller end their subscription.
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation modifies the term 'renew'. Initially, both parties in writing need to agree within 30 days of license expiration, but the modified term states that either party written consent is enough to renew the agreement. It also introduces conflicting text about the obligation to remit payments to Reseller, initially cease 30 days after termination of this Agreement, but the modified version states that the obligation to remit payment continue until all buyers end their subscription. This introduces ambiguity about how long does the obligation continues.

perturbation.original_text:
13.5 INDEPENDENT CONTRACTORS. The parties are independent contractors with
respect to each other. Each party is not and shall not be deemed to be an
employees, agent, joint venture Reseller or legal representative of the
other for any purpose and shall not have any right, power, or authority to
create any obligation or responsibility on behalf of the other.
perturbation.changed_text:
13.5 INDEPENDENT CONTRACTORS. The parties are independent contractors with
respect to each other, except that Reseller shall be deemed an agent of MediaNet Group Technologies for the sole purpose of marketing and selling the Portals.  Each party is not and shall not be deemed to be an employees, agent, joint venture Reseller or legal representative of the
other for any purpose and shall not have any right, power, or authority to
create any obligation or responsibility on behalf of the other.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an internal contradiction to the 'Independent Contractor' clause. While initially stating they are independent, it now includes a clause that the Reseller is an agent for marketing and selling. This creates uncertainty about the legal relationship, especially regarding liability and authority.
